For those of you still struggling with Starforce, here is a readme I made for Race Driver 2. The solution should be very similar for GTR.

How to make it run: (Without crack, taking out power cables etc)

By Warterix


1. Install game from original CD/DVD or favourite image file.

2. Install 1.2 patch. (Any patches released should work)

3. Run the program called "sfdrvrem.exe". 
   (found at     http://www.star-force.com/index.phtml?category=200&type=5)
   (This will take away any starforce drivers).
   Reboot. 
4. Run the program named SFNightmare.exe. (Starforce Nightmare)   

5. Depending on what channels you have your cd/dvds on,       (buttons Pr.Slave off,
Sc.Master off or Sc.Slave off), turn them off in SFNightmare. You may check    
with your bios or a system program to find out. 
This will disable your CD/DVD so starforce can't find them.

6. Try to run the game. (RD2.exe) Shortcuts may not work. You will get a message 
to restart your computer. Do so. This will install Starforce drivers again.

7. Start an image tool, (Deamon Tools, Alcohol 120%) and mount the file 
Racedriver2_eur.mdf. (For european version mini-image)    

8. Try to run the game. (RD2.exe) Copy serial from file if asked to.

You should now be able to succesfully start the game. If not, and you can hear 
cd/dvd-rom being activated you need to press the off buttons again in SFNightmare.exe.
If Starforce can't find any real cd/dvd it will use the virtual image.

To enable cd/dvd, press the on buttons parallell to the off button you pressed.
When you want to play the game again after enabling cd/dvd, start from nr.3.  
Complicated? Blame Starforce. If you want it easier, buy the game.

I got the same error as all of you other but.....

Here is how i did it!

Open your Computer box, make sure that your hdd drives are on one IDE, and cddvd roms on the other IDE. 
These is because you need to klick "Disable channel 1 or 2 in starforce nightmare, to make it work! If your cddvdroms are on IDE 2, you´ll need to klick on "disable channel 2"

So follow the insttuccion that is given in info file, + klick on the "Disable chanel 1 or 2" (as explained above)
And now it will work At least it worked fine for me!!!!

Allright, I finally got it too work..................

Bad news is for anyone who gets the "invalid cd key" error, somehow the serial got blacklisted in the registry, I got fed up so I just reformatted my computer and that took care of it, it played fine with the directions, and for the people who get the "insert disc" errors, you all are just doing something else wrong, If everyone follows the directions EXACTLY, than it should work. BUT if if your serial is Blacklisted, just reformat and save yourself some pain.

GTR FIA GT Racing Game multi-5 EURO v1.3.0.0

Running it:

* mount the full image and install
* run the game and reboot when asked
* run starforce nightmare and choose to :

    1. turn OFF all your CD or DVD drives by pressing "Pr.Master Off" 
and/or "Pr.Slave Off" and/or Sc.Master Off" and/or Sc.Slave Off"

!!! DO NOT USE THE "DISABLE CD" BUTTON !!!

    2. Disable node

* mount the mini-image in demon-tools or alcohol 120%
* run the game
* use your serial when asked
* wait a few seconds and finally play the game !!!

Never Mind! Works fine now...actually...the description on the bottom of this page is kinda hard and unecessery...i just downloaded starforce nightmare and pressed disable cd and disable node and used a crack i found at gamcopyworld.com....by the way...can i get online with this version??

It works great, I was having problems with starforce but finally managed to work doing the same things already explained in the info plus disabling my ide channel where my cd/dvd drives are pluged in.
so the way in starforce nightmare is:

- DISABLE CD
- DISABLE CHN2 (or the channel where your cd/dvd drives are connected)
- DISABLE NODE

now you can exit starforce nightmare and run the game..
note: if you are using an IDE hard disk connected in the same channel of your cd/dvd drive, this surely will not work, so just leave your hardk disk alone in the primary channel and connect all the optical drives in the secondary channel as must be..
note2: you don´t need to reinstall the game at any moment, works in all the languagues and if you need to change the serial just do it from the registry.

Oops, forget it, it got started now :) Can't wait to play it :)

Unplug CD Drives.
Install Daemon Tools 3.47.
Mount CD1. Enable All Emulation.
Unmount CD1.
Mount CD2.
Turn Off Computer.
Reconnect CD Drives.
Boot.
Unmount CD2.
Mount MiniImage.
Run SFNightmare.
Disable Your Physical Drive - For Ex. Pr.Master Off.
(Very Important You Disable The Correct One)
Disable CD.
Disable Node.
Run GTR And Insert CD-Key.
If It Does'nt Work The First Time.
Delete [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWARESBDT ABGTRSF Keys] Folder.
Repeat SFNightmare.
Run GTR And Insert CD-Key.

Heard This Works ;)

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\SBDT AB\GTR\SF Keys] "DiscKey_GTR_CD1"="")

 Got it working with that way
